meanings.definition: A group of carbohydrates produced by the partial hydrolysis of starch.
meanings.sent1: The dextrines are created when starch is partially broken down.
meanings.sent2: Food manufacturers use dextrines to thicken sauces and soups.
meanings.sent3: The dextrines in the recipe made the pudding extra creamy.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as sweet as dextrines, bringing warmth to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The dextrines glistened like tiny crystals under the microscope.

meanings.definition: A substance used in the food industry as a thickening agent.
meanings.sent1: Chefs rely on dextrines to give the right consistency to gravies.
meanings.sent2: The bakery added dextrines to the batter to make the cake fluffy.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally spilled dextrines all over the kitchen, creating a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words acted as dextrines, binding the team together in harmony.
meanings.sent5: The dextrines swirled smoothly into the soup, making it rich and velvety.

meanings.definition: A type of sugar formed during the breakdown of complex carbohydrates.
meanings.sent1: Our bodies convert complex carbs into dextrines for energy.
meanings.sent2: Dextrines are a natural product of digesting foods like potatoes.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf sprinkled dextrines on the cookies, making them irresistible.
meanings.sent4: His laughter was like dextrines, spreading sweetness wherever it reached.
meanings.sent5: The dextrines danced on the taste buds, leaving a delightful aftertaste.
